alert.note: Alert for City of Winchester (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:21PM EDT until May 10 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Virginia and eastern West Virginia, including the following counties: in northwest Virginia, City of Winchester and Frederick. In eastern West Virginia, Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Law enforcement reports multiple roads remain closed due to flooding in Frederick and eastern Hampshire Counties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain had occurred in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester... Millwood Pike... Stephens City... Star Tannery... Middletown... Capon Bridge... Rock Enon Springs... High View... Gore... Lehew... Timber Ridge... Wilde Acres... High View Manor... Whitacre... Cross Junction... Gainesboro... Yellow Spring... Capon Springs... Bloomery... Gravel Springs... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
